Today, we celebrate our enduring Constitution, a document that has guided our nation for over 200 years. It's a reminder of our commitment to liberty, justice, and democracy. 

Let's cherish and protect these principles that make our nation strong.

I am closely monitoring the formal inquiry Speaker McCarthy announced today and have the utmost confidence in the investigative tools Congress has at its disposal to help us determine the facts.

I am pleased that Congress will have the opportunity to examine the allegations against President Biden. At the same time, I am committed to legislating as well as oversight, both of which are important work that my colleagues and I have been sent to Washington to do. I will continue to advocate for full transparency while getting things done for Utahns. #utpol

My week in D.C. has just gotten started and I've already passed two of my bills through the House.

✅ Taiwan International Solidarity Act
✅NTIA Policy and Cybersecurity Act

Shaping up to be a good week 👍

Proud to see my bill to streamline cybersecurity efforts at the NTIA pass the House today.

Hackers are working overtime to find vulnerabilities in our networks and infrastructure.

We must work even harder to ensure that Americans are protected from cyberattacks.

✅Taiwan International Solidarity Act has passed the House. 

This bipartisan legislation w/ @GerryConnolly builds on the TAIPEI Act and stands strong in support of Taiwan's rightful place on the global stage.

Making sure the US has the means to protect and repair these connections is vital to commerce and the security of the U.S. and our partners around the world. This amendment ensures our military and its partners are ready to act.
Cables around the world keep us online and are susceptible to breaking from ocean currents, earthquakes, and the actions of rogue states like Russia and China. web.archive.org/web/20230510…
Our internet is not connected through wireless connections as many think.  More than 95% of international data is transmitted through cables across the ocean.

Since the War in Ukraine started, Russia has threatened to undermine NATO efforts to communicate and block citizens access to the internet.  Meanwhile, China has taken action to isolate Taiwan by cutting cables.
GREAT NEWS: My bipartisan amendment with @RepLBR to protect undersea cables from sabotage has been included in the National Defense Authorization Act. 🧵

Those of us that know his work best know that everything from our vibrant economy to our fun downtown and so much more have been blessed by Wayne’s hard work and dedication to Provo City. #utpol heraldextra.com/news/local/2…

Let me state clearly for the record, that for decades and decades and decades, the good people of Utah have managed these lands in a responsible way.

Today in @NatResources, we are discussing proper land management, but yet, nearly all my Democratic colleagues are absent.

I am tired of bureaucrats, who have never been to Utah or the West for that matter, except to fly to California, lecture us on how to manage these lands.

Many of the videos I take on this page feature the flag in these images. On this #FlagDay, let me tell you more of the story behind it:

Just before COVID, I had a chance to visit Afghanistan and meet our troops over there. I saw and learned more about where Brent Taylor lost his life and speak to his friends and those who served with him in the National Guard. While there, this flag was flown from a Blackhawk helicopter, and to my surprise, the Guard sent the flag back to me.

It's a powerful reminder for me in Washington and symbolizes dedication, sacrifice, and the spirit of America. Let's reflect on its significance, honor our heroes, and preserve the ideals that make our nation exceptional.
Highs and lows this week! Lots to cover so be sure to sign up for my newsletter for more: curtisforms.house.gov/forms/…
Together, we can create a safer and healthier future for all. 🙌 #WildfirePrevention #BipartisanSolutions 5/5)

💡 It’s not just about talking; it's about taking meaningful action. We're pushing for fully funding wildfire suppression and prevention, investing in new technologies, and supporting research that will help us better understand and combat these devastating fires. (4/5)

🤝 In the  Caucus, Republicans and Democrats are setting aside differences to find common ground. We understand the urgency of this issue and the need for collaboration. Let's work together to implement practical solutions that ensure the safety of our homes and environment. (3/5)

🌲 That's why I'm proud to be a co-lead of the bipartisan wildfire caucus with @RepJoeNeguse. Together, we're working to address these devastating wildfires. By promoting responsible mitigation, we can protect our communities and improve our quality of life. (2/5)

🔥 As wildfire smoke continues drifting across the East Coast and Midwest, I empathize with those experiencing what we endure all too often out West. Our air quality is suffering, primarily, due to bad forest management decisions. (1/5)

🏆 Honored to receive the 2023 Joseph H. Rainey Empowered Leadership Award from the Joseph Rainey Center for Public Policy alongside Senator Thom Tillis. I'm humbled to be recognized for my work in Congress. Thank you! 🇺🇸

Since coming to Congress, I have not voted for a single omnibus spending bill or debt ceiling increase. While not perfect, this is the first bill I have been presented that gets Washington to spend less than it did last year and move towards balancing our budget. curtis.house.gov/news/docume…

As a delegation, we are deeply saddened by the announcement of our dear friend, Rep. Chris Stewart. Throughout our time in this institution, he has warmly embraced each of us and played a vital role in our collective achievements for the people of Utah. As the Dean of our delegation, Chris has been an invaluable source of guidance, and we know that his wisdom will remain accessible during the remainder of his time here and after his departure. Utah is losing a dedicated public servant, and his presence will be greatly missed within these chambers. As he transitions to prioritizing time with Evie, we extend our thoughts and support to him and his entire family.

As we observe Memorial Day, my thoughts are with heroes like Staff Sgt. Aaron Butler from Monticello, Maj. Brent Taylor from North Ogden, and Staff Sgt. Darin Taylor Hoover, Jr. from Midvale who all exemplified true patriotism with their tireless dedication to our country. Their legacy, along with countless others, underscores the importance of this solemn day of remembrance. Their sacrifices, and those of their families, constitute the very bedrock of the ideals we cherish. 

My own father's service during World War II has always been a source of pride and gratitude for me. Their contributions remind us that every freedom we enjoy is built on the sacrifice of these brave individuals and we take the opportunity to express our deepest and most profound gratitude to those who have fallen in the service of our country. I thank them, their families, and all those who are willing to serve our way of life. 

May God bless them, and the United States of America.

Each of us will have our own Fridays-those days when the universe itself seems shattered and the shards of our world lie littered about us in pieces.

But I testify to you in the name of the One who conquered death-Sunday will come. In the darkness of our sorrow, Sunday will come. [.] In this life or the next, Sunday will come. 

— Joseph Wirthlin

I wish I could have brought you all along with the week I have had. Every Friday I wrap up what I've been up to in a weekly email. If you have not signed up, hit the link on the video. 

Until next time, hope you have a good weekend.

I joined the team at KLCY in the Basin to discuss the House passing an energy and climate bill aimed at lowering costs to consumers and to speak about land legislation passed this year. Grateful for the opportunity to share insights on important topics.
Touring Simplot Phosphate Mine in Vernal, UT. Remarkable to see water reuse, land reclamation, and wildlife-friendly practices. Excited about Simplot's partnership with Utah to enhance SR-191 safety.

I am proud of the work our schools are doing to improve their environmental impact. Alpine School District has significantly reduced their carbon footprint and saved millions in energy costs through smart optimization efforts. Keep up the good work! heraldextra.com/news/local/2…

#ICYMI HR 1 is an opportunity for the US to reemerge as a global leader and power the world with our clean resources, all while creating more jobs at home. It’s past time for the US to rise to the occasion and provide clean, affordable, and reliable energy to the world.
China can not dictate who Members of Congress meet with on US soil. I look forward to meeting with President @iingwen today with @SpeakerMcCarthy.

The path to affordable, reliable, safe, and clean energy starts here with H.R. 1. I applaud the passage of this bill.

H.R. 1 represents a definitive pathway to achieving affordable, reliable, and clean energy for all Americans. It is imperative that we recognize the U.S. energy sector not as an adversary, but as a vital partner in shaping a sustainable and prosperous energy future.

Today, on #NationalVietnamWarVeteransDay, we honor the bravery and sacrifice of those who served in the Vietnam War. We remember their dedication to our nation and express our deepest gratitude for their service. To our Vietnam veterans: Thank you for your courage. 🇺🇸

Great to meet with the Utah League of Cities and Towns today! As a former mayor, I value their dedication to our communities. We discussed rising costs, permitting challenges, and the work my staff and I are undertaking for Utahns.

The TikTok hearing left more questions than answers. I don’t think any of us walked away feeling that our data is safe or that there is any accountability for TikTok.

The Parents Bill of Rights Act, which simply ensures parents have a right to know what their children are taught in school and gives parents a voice in publicly funded education, has passed the House of Representatives. 

Prioritizing parents in education is critical and I am proud to support this bill.
Elevating harmful posts without accountability and diminishing free speech should not be tolerated.

I’ll be asking the CEO of TikTok, Mr. Chew about content manipulation and examine the role of algorithms and the potential impact on policy issues. 

Tune in to learn how social media platforms like TikTok handle user data and their influence on elections. 

Has TikTok ever crossed the line? Find out by tuning in below:
